{"post_stream":{"posts":[{"id":3537326,"name":"6894 Lead prog/driver","username":"Mochatitan","avatar_template":"/user_avatar/www.chiefdelphi.com/mochatitan/{size}/237112_2.png","created_at":"2025-02-23T18:52:07.278Z","cooked":"

we used CTRE swerve generator to generate a swerve drive, but we have encountered a lot of issues with it.

drive.google.com

IMG_7945.mov

Google Drive file.

This is a video of us testing it, it seems to be jittering when we move it around in a circle with the controller, but it seems to move smoothly when we point it forward, reset the controller input, and then point right. We have tried to tune the PID values in so many ways, but no matter what the jittering wont seem to stop.

SOS. any questions will be answered immediately.

","post_number":1,"post_type":1,"posts_count":15,"updated_at":"2025-02-23T18:52:07.278Z","reply_count":0,"reply_to_post_number":null,"quote_count":0,"incoming_link_count":19,"reads":105,"readers_count":104,"score":131.0,"yours":false,"topic_id":492864,"topic_slug":"ctre-swerve-drive-jittering","display_username":"6894 Lead prog/driver","primary_group_name":null,"flair_name":null,"flair_url":null,"flair_bg_color":null,"flair_color":null,"flair_group_id":null,"badges_granted":[],"version":1,"can_edit":false,"can_delete":false,"can_recover":false,"can_see_hidden_post":true,"can_wiki":false,"link_counts":[{"url":"https://drive.google.com/file/d/1I59y-Lskk59QHa65vYSYsGR1-x6hG5u4/view?usp=sharing","internal":false,"reflection":false,"title":"IMG_7945.mov - Google Drive","clicks":33}],"read":true,"user_title":"","bookmarked":false,"actions_summary":[{"id":2,"count":1}],"moderator":false,"admin":false,"staff":false,"user_id":63063,"hidden":false,"trust_level":2,"deleted_at":null,"user_deleted":false,"edit_reason":null,"can_view_edit_history":true,"wiki":false,"user_custom_fields":{"user_field_4":"6894 | Lead prog/Driver"},"post_url":"/t/ctre-swerve-drive-jittering/492864/1","custom_user_title":"6894 | Lead prog/Driver","reactions":[{"id":"heart","type":"emoji","count":1}],"current_user_reaction":null,"reaction_users_count":1,"current_user_used_main_reaction":false,"can_accept_answer":false,"can_unaccept_answer":false,"accepted_answer":false,"topic_accepted_answer":null,"can_vote":false},{"id":3537345,"name":"Dalton","username":"daltzsmith","avatar_template":"/user_avatar/www.chiefdelphi.com/daltzsmith/{size}/206287_2.png","created_at":"2025-02-23T19:12:09.492Z","cooked":"

Have you tried a different controller? What a lot of folks think of as a “smooth” rotation with a joystick is actually jittery with their fingers slipping or resetting.

To prove this, try logging your joystick values to WPILog and plot them. If it’s truly circular, then both your X and Y on that joystick should appear to be nice and smooth.

","post_number":7,"post_type":1,"posts_count":15,"updated_at":"2025-02-23T19:53:06.967Z","reply_count":0,"reply_to_post_number":6,"quote_count":0,"incoming_link_count":0,"reads":61,"readers_count":60,"score":12.2,"yours":false,"topic_id":492864,"topic_slug":"ctre-swerve-drive-jittering","display_username":"6894 Lead prog/driver","primary_group_name":null,"flair_name":null,"flair_url":null,"flair_bg_color":null,"flair_color":null,"flair_group_id":null,"badges_granted":[],"version":1,"can_edit":false,"can_delete":false,"can_recover":false,"can_see_hidden_post":true,"can_wiki":false,"read":true,"user_title":"","reply_to_user":{"id":61981,"username":"daltzsmith","name":"Dalton","avatar_template":"/user_avatar/www.chiefdelphi.com/daltzsmith/{size}/206287_2.png"},"bookmarked":false,"actions_summary":[],"moderator":false,"admin":false,"staff":false,"user_id":63063,"hidden":false,"trust_level":2,"deleted_at":null,"user_deleted":false,"edit_reason":null,"can_view_edit_history":true,"wiki":false,"user_custom_fields":{"user_field_4":"6894 | Lead prog/Driver"},"post_url":"/t/ctre-swerve-drive-jittering/492864/7","custom_user_title":"6894 | Lead prog/Driver","reactions":[],"current_user_reaction":null,"reaction_users_count":0,"current_user_used_main_reaction":false,"can_accept_answer":false,"can_unaccept_answer":false,"accepted_answer":false,"topic_accepted_answer":null},{"id":3537446,"name":"6894 Lead prog/driver","username":"Mochatitan","avatar_template":"/user_avatar/www.chiefdelphi.com/mochatitan/{size}/237112_2.png","created_at":"2025-02-23T21:22:57.007Z","cooked":"

wait, i used the driver station to track controller axis values, and the jiter position changed each time the controller updated. the controller values were only being tracked by 2 decimal places, and the motor would burst forward a bit and then fall back it seems, so i have two theories.

  1. we need a more accurate controller value tracker, so that it can move smoother instead of jumping
  2. despite being a small change in axis value, the swerve turn jumps forward too far and then tries to quickly correct itself, even if it already has a new input to go to.
","post_number":8,"post_type":1,"posts_count":15,"updated_at":"2025-02-23T21:22:57.007Z","reply_count":0,"reply_to_post_number":6,"quote_count":0,"incoming_link_count":1,"reads":56,"readers_count":55,"score":16.2,"yours":false,"topic_id":492864,"topic_slug":"ctre-swerve-drive-jittering","display_username":"6894 Lead prog/driver","primary_group_name":null,"flair_name":null,"flair_url":null,"flair_bg_color":null,"flair_color":null,"flair_group_id":null,"badges_granted":[],"version":1,"can_edit":false,"can_delete":false,"can_recover":false,"can_see_hidden_post":true,"can_wiki":false,"read":true,"user_title":"","reply_to_user":{"id":61981,"username":"daltzsmith","name":"Dalton","avatar_template":"/user_avatar/www.chiefdelphi.com/daltzsmith/{size}/206287_2.png"},"bookmarked":false,"actions_summary":[],"moderator":false,"admin":false,"staff":false,"user_id":63063,"hidden":false,"trust_level":2,"deleted_at":null,"user_deleted":false,"edit_reason":null,"can_view_edit_history":true,"wiki":false,"user_custom_fields":{"user_field_4":"6894 | Lead prog/Driver"},"post_url":"/t/ctre-swerve-drive-jittering/492864/8","custom_user_title":"6894 | Lead prog/Driver","reactions":[],"current_user_reaction":null,"reaction_users_count":0,"current_user_used_main_reaction":false,"can_accept_answer":false,"can_unaccept_answer":false,"accepted_answer":false,"topic_accepted_answer":null},{"id":3537457,"name":"Kaleb Dodd","username":"Kaleb_Dodd","avatar_template":"/user_avatar/www.chiefdelphi.com/kaleb_dodd/{size}/7859_2.png","created_at":"2025-02-23T21:39:17.204Z","cooked":"

We noticed very similar behaviour with the steering using the pre generated values, we used the pre generated values in 2024 with no issues but for this year the steering is very jumpy and will cause that sound to come from the modules.

For a temporary fix I would try it with just P and see if the jumping goes away and then tune from there.

even if all the values for PID are set to 0, it still jitters

","post_number":10,"post_type":1,"posts_count":15,"updated_at":"2025-02-23T21:41:20.177Z","reply_count":1,"reply_to_post_number":9,"quote_count":0,"incoming_link_count":1,"reads":52,"readers_count":51,"score":20.4,"yours":false,"topic_id":492864,"topic_slug":"ctre-swerve-drive-jittering","display_username":"6894 Lead prog/driver","primary_group_name":null,"flair_name":null,"flair_url":null,"flair_bg_color":null,"flair_color":null,"flair_group_id":null,"badges_granted":[],"version":1,"can_edit":false,"can_delete":false,"can_recover":false,"can_see_hidden_post":true,"can_wiki":false,"read":true,"user_title":"","reply_to_user":{"id":23840,"username":"Kaleb_Dodd","name":"Kaleb Dodd","avatar_template":"/user_avatar/www.chiefdelphi.com/kaleb_dodd/{size}/7859_2.png"},"bookmarked":false,"actions_summary":[],"moderator":false,"admin":false,"staff":false,"user_id":63063,"hidden":false,"trust_level":2,"deleted_at":null,"user_deleted":false,"edit_reason":null,"can_view_edit_history":true,"wiki":false,"user_custom_fields":{"user_field_4":"6894 | Lead prog/Driver"},"post_url":"/t/ctre-swerve-drive-jittering/492864/10","custom_user_title":"6894 | Lead prog/Driver","reactions":[],"current_user_reaction":null,"reaction_users_count":0,"current_user_used_main_reaction":false,"can_accept_answer":false,"can_unaccept_answer":false,"accepted_answer":false,"topic_accepted_answer":null},{"id":3537460,"name":"Kaleb Dodd","username":"Kaleb_Dodd","avatar_template":"/user_avatar/www.chiefdelphi.com/kaleb_dodd/{size}/7859_2.png","created_at":"2025-02-23T21:43:58.118Z","cooked":"

If they are all 0 it should stop moving.

We tried a kp of 40 and everything else including ks,kv,ka, set to 0. And that fixed the issue. We are using krakens on a wcp module, so the kp may not be exactly right but it should at least stop the stuttering sound.
